00051 /*! The possible data types stored in a BAR file. */
00052 typedef enum _GDACFILES_BAR_DATA_TYPE
00053 {
00054         /*! Double precision (64 bit) floating point. */
00055         BAR_DATA_DOUBLE,
00056 
00057         /*! Single precision (32 bit) floating point. */
00058         BAR_DATA_FLOAT,
00059 
00060         /*! 32 bit signed integer. */
00061         BAR_DATA_INTEGER,
00062 
00063         /*! 16 bit signed integer. */
00064         BAR_DATA_SHORT,
00065 
00066         /*! 8 bit signed integer. */
00067         BAR_DATA_CHAR,
00068 
00069         /*! 32 bit unsigned integer. */
00070         BAR_DATA_UINTEGER,
00071 
00072         /*! 16 bit unsigned integer. */
00073         BAR_DATA_USHORT,
00074 
00075         /*! 8 bit unsigned integer. */
00076         BAR_DATA_UCHAR
00077 
00078 } GDACFILES_BAR_DATA_TYPE;
00079 
00080 /*! An STL vector of data types. */
00081 typedef std::vector<GDACFILES_BAR_DATA_TYPE> GDACFILES_BAR_DATA_TYPE_VECTOR;
00082

00084 
00085 /*! This union is used to store data associated with a single value. */
00086 typedef union _BarSequenceResultData
00087 {
00088         /*! Double precision (64 bit) floating point. */
00089         double dValue;
00090 
00091         /*! Single precision (32 bit) floating point. */
00092         float fValue;
00093 
00094         /*! 32 bit signed integer. */
00095         int iValue;
00096 
00097         /*! 16 bit signed integer. */
00098         short sValue;
00099 
00100         /*! 8 bit signed integer. */
00101         char cValue;
00102 
00103         /*! 32 bit unsigned integer. */
00104         unsigned int uiValue;
00105 
00106         /*! 16 bit unsigned integer. */
00107         unsigned short usValue;
00108 
00109         /*! 8 bit unsigned integer. */
00110         unsigned char ucValue;
00111 } BarSequenceResultData;

00115 /*! This class provides storage for results associated with a sequence. */
00116 class CGDACSequenceResultItem
00117 {
00118 public:
00119         /*! Constructor */
00120         CGDACSequenceResultItem();
00121 
00122         /*! Destructor */
00123         ~CGDACSequenceResultItem();
00124 
00125 protected:
00126         /*! The name of the sequence. */
00127         std::string m_Name;
00128 
00129         /*! The version associated to the sequence. */
00130         std::string m_Version;
00131 
00132         /*! The group name for the sequence. */
00133         std::string m_GroupName;
00134 
00135         /*! The number of data points associated with the sequence. */
00136         int m_NumberDataPoints;
00137 
00138         /*! The number of columns of data for each data point. */
00139         int m_NumberColumns;
00140 
00141         /*! The number of name/value parameters. */
00142         int m_NumberParameters;
00143 
00144         /*! A pointer to the BAR file's column types vector. */
00145         GDACFILES_BAR_DATA_TYPE_VECTOR *m_pColumnTypes;
00146 
00147         /*! The parameter name/value array. */
00148         TagValuePairTypeVector m_Parameters;
00149 
00150         /*! A pointer to the data. */
00151         BarSequenceResultData **m_ppData;
00152 
00153         /*! A pointer to the data pointer.
00154          * This is used when making copies of the object. The data pointer is not duplicated,
00155          * just a pointer to the data object is made. */
00156         BarSequenceResultData ***m_pppData;
00157 
00158         /*! Flag indicating if the file is memory mapped. */
00159         bool m_bMapped;
00160 
00161         /*! Pointer to the memory mapped file. */
00162         char *m_lpData;
00163 
00164         /*! The file position of the start of the data. */
00165         int m_DataStartPosition;
00166 
00167         /*! Makes a copy of the object. The results are not copied to the new object, just
00168          * the pointer back to the originating object.
00169          * @param orig The object to copy.
00170          */
00171         void MakeShallowCopy(CGDACSequenceResultItem &orig);
00172 
00173 public:
00174         /*! Gets the sequence name.
00175          * @return The sequence name.
00176          */
00177         std::string GetName() const { return m_Name; }
00178 
00179         /*! Gets the version number.
00180          * @return The version number.
00181          */
00182         std::string GetVersion() const { return m_Version; }
00183 
00184         /*! Gets the group name.
00185          * @return The group name.
00186          */
00187         std::string GetGroupName() const { return m_GroupName; }
00188 
00189         /*! Returns the full name (name, group, version).
00190          * @return The full name.
00191          */
00192         std::string GetFullName() const;
00193 
00194         /*! Gets the number of data points (rows).
00195          * @return The number of data points (rows).
00196          */
00197         int GetNumberDataPoints() const { return m_NumberDataPoints; }
00198 
00199         /*! Gets the number of columns.
00200          * @return The number of columns.
00201          */
00202         int GetNumberColumns() const { return m_NumberColumns; }
00203 
00204         /*! Gets the type of data for a column.
00205          * @param index The column index.
00206          * @return The type of data at the given column.
00207          */
00208         GDACFILES_BAR_DATA_TYPE GetColumnType(int index) const { return (*m_pColumnTypes)[index]; }
00209 
00210         /*! Gets the data for a given position.
00211          * @param iData The row index.
00212          * @param iCol The column index.
00213          * @param data The returned data.
00214          */
00215         void GetData(int iData, int iCol, BarSequenceResultData &data );
00216 
00217         /*! Gets the number of parameters.
00218          * @return The number of parameters.
00219          */
00220         int GetNumberParameters() const { return m_NumberParameters; }
00221 
00222         /*! Gets the parameter at the given index.
00223          * @param index The index to the parameter array.
00224          * @return The parameter.
00225          */
00226         TagValuePairType &GetParameter(int index) { return m_Parameters[index]; }
00227 
00228         /*! Sets the sequence name.
00229          * @param name The sequence name.
00230          */
00231         void SetName(const char *name) { m_Name = name; }
00232 
00233         /*! Sets the version.
00234          * @param ver The version.
00235          */
00236         void SetVersion(const char *ver) { m_Version = ver; }
00237 
00238         /*! Sets the group name.
00239          * @param group The group name.
00240          */
00241         void SetGroupName(const char *group) { m_GroupName = group; }
00242 
00243         /*! Sets the number of data points and allocate memory for the results.
00244          * @param n The number of data points (rows).
00245          */
00246         void SetNumberDataPoints(int n);
00247 
00248         /*! Sets the data point (when writing a file).
00249          * @param nIndex The row index.
00250          * @param colIndex The column index.
00251          * @param data The value of the data point.
00252          */
00253         void SetDataPoint(int nIndex, int colIndex, BarSequenceResultData &data);
00254 
00255         /*! Adds a parameter to the list.
00256          * @param tag The name of the parameter.
00257          * @param value The value of the parameter.*
00258          */
00259         void AddParameter(std::string tag, std::string value);
00260 
00261         /*! Friend to the top level class. */
00262         friend class CBARFileData;
00263 };

00267 /*! The class provides storage and reading capabilities for BAR files. */
00268 class CBARFileData
00269 {
00270 public:
00271         /*! Constructor */
00272         CBARFileData();
00273 
00274         /*! Destructor */
00275         ~CBARFileData();
00276 
00277 protected:
00278         /*! The full path to the BAR file. */
00279         std::string m_FileName;
00280 
00281         /*! The version number of the file. */
00282         float   m_Version;
00283 
00284         /*! The number of sequences in the file. */
00285         int m_NumberSequences;
00286 
00287         /*! The number of columns of data in each sequence entry. */
00288         int m_NumberColumns;
00289 
00290         /*! The number of name/value paramters. */
00291         int m_NumberParameters;
00292 
00293         /*! The start position of the data. */
00294         int m_DataStartPosition;
00295 
00296         /*! The name/value parameters. */
00297         TagValuePairTypeVector m_Parameters;
00298 
00299         /*! The types of data stored in each column. */
00300         GDACFILES_BAR_DATA_TYPE_VECTOR m_ColumnTypes;
00301 
00302         /*! The sequence results. */
00303         std::vector<CGDACSequenceResultItem> m_Results;
00304 
00305         /*! A string to hold error messages. */
00306         std::string m_strError;
00307 
00308         /*! Reads the file.
00309          * @param bReadHeaderOnly Flag to indicate if the header should only be read.
00310          * @return True if successful.
00311          */
00312         bool ReadFile(bool bReadHeaderOnly=false);
00313 
00314         /*! Reads the file header
00315          * @return True if successful.
00316          */
00317         bool ReadHeaderSection();
00318 
00319         /*! Reads the file data (after the header).
00320          * @return True if successful.
00321          */
00322         bool ReadDataSection();
00323 
00324         /*! Gets the size of a row of data.
00325          * @return The number of bytes per data row.
00326          */
00327         int GetDataRowSize();
00328 
00329         /*! Pointer to a memory mapped file. */
00330         void  *m_lpFileMap;
00331 
00332         /*! Pointer to the data in the memory mapped file. */
00333         char  *m_lpData;
00334 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00335 
00336         /*! Windows handle to the file. */
00337         HANDLE m_hFileMap;
00338 
00339         /*! Windows handle to the file. */
00340         HANDLE m_hFile;
00341 #else
00342         /*! File pointer for memory mapping. */
00343         FILE *m_fp;
00344 
00345         /*! The size of the file. */
00346         int m_MapLen;
00347 #endif
00348 
00349         /*! Flag indicating if the file is open. */
00350         bool m_bFileOpen;
00351 
00352         /*! Flag indicating if the file is memory mapped. */
00353         bool m_bFileMapped;
00354 
00355 public:
00356         /*! Sets the full path to the BAR file.
00357          * @param name The file name.
00358          */
00359         void SetFileName (const char *name) { m_FileName = name; }
00360 
00361         /*! Gets the full path of the file.
00362          * @return The full path of the file.
00363          */
00364         std::string GetFileName() const { return m_FileName; }
00365 
00366         /*! Reads the contents of the file.
00367          * @return True if successful.
00368          */
00369         bool Read();
00370 
00371         /*! Reads the header of the file.
00372          * @return True if successful.
00373          */
00374         bool ReadHeader();
00375 
00376         /*! Checks if the file exists.
00377          * @return True if exists.
00378          */
00379         bool Exists();
00380 
00381         /*! Closes and deallocate memory. */
00382         void Close();
00383 
00384         /*! Gets an error string for file read errors.
00385          * @return An error string for file read errors.
00386          */
00387         std::string GetError() const { return m_strError; }
00388 
00389         /*! Gets the file version.
00390          * @return The file version.
00391          */
00392         float GetVersion() const { return m_Version; }
00393 
00394         /*! Gets the number of sequence stored in the file.
00395          * @return The number of sequence stored in the file.
00396          */
00397         int GetNumberSequences() const { return m_NumberSequences; }
00398 
00399         /*! Gets the number of columns of data per row.
00400          * @return The number of columns of data per row.
00401          */
00402         int     GetNumberColumns() const { return m_NumberColumns; }
00403 
00404         /*! Gets the number of name/value parameters.
00405          * @return The number of name/value parameters.
00406          */
00407         int GetNumberParameters() const { return m_NumberParameters; }
00408 
00409         /*! Gets the name/value parameter.
00410          * @param index The index to the parameter of interest.
00411          * @return The name/value parameter given the index.
00412          */
00413         TagValuePairType &GetParameter(int index) { return m_Parameters[index]; }
00414 
00415         /*! Gets the type of data stored.
00416          * @param index The column index.
00417          * @return The type of data stored in the column.
00418          */
00419         GDACFILES_BAR_DATA_TYPE &GetColumnTypes(int index) { return m_ColumnTypes[index]; }
00420 
00421         /*! Gets the sequence data.
00422          * @param index The sequence index.
00423          * @param seq The sequence data.
00424          */
00425         void GetResults(int index, CGDACSequenceResultItem &seq);
00426 
00427         /*! Adds a parameter to the list.
00428          * @param tag The parameter name.
00429          * @param value The parameter value.
00430          */
00431         void AddAlgorithmParameter(const char *tag, const char *value);
00432 
00433         /*! Adds a column for writing a BAR file.
00434          * @param ctype The type of data to store at the column.
00435          */
00436         void AddColumn(GDACFILES_BAR_DATA_TYPE ctype);
00437 
00438         /*! Sets the number of sequences to store in the BAR file.
00439          * @param n The number of sequences.
00440          */
00441         void SetNumberSequences(int n);
00442 
00443         /*! Retrieves a pointer to the sequences results. This should only be used when 
00444          * performing write operations. Use the GetResults functions when reading the file.
00445          * @param index The sequence index.
00446          * @return A pointer to the sequence results.
00447          */
00448         CGDACSequenceResultItem *GetResultsPtr(int index) { return &m_Results[index]; }
00449 };
